Key Arguments: The bill threatens free speech and democracy by allowing the government to decide what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
Historical examples show that government control over information can lead to dictatorial regimes.
The bill could lead to biased enforcement, as fact-checkers and experts may have conflicts of interest.
The bill contradicts the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which protects free speech.
The bill could discriminate against religious beliefs if they oppose government policies.
Existing legal systems should handle misinformation and disinformation, not a government agency like ACMA.
Main Themes: Bias and conflicts of interest in determining truth
Notable Quotes: Truth is like water, given time, it will always make its way through to the surface.
This bill will take Australia further toward an Orwellian dictatorship where any opposing view will be labelled disinformation / misinformation and the proposer of the opposing view will be silenced.
Time will reveal the truth, leave debate alone and let time expose the misinformation.
